title: Berlin’s green unicorn Enpal to get €215 million cash boost to supercharge its mission of creating a more sustainable ... - EU-Startups
summary: Enpal, a Berlin-based company, has recently received €215 million in growth capital. The company, which provides solar energy systems and other renewable energy products, is aiming to help facilitate a transition to clean energy sources across Europe. Enpal's approach involves offering a comprehensive solution that includes solar panels, energy storage, and smart home features, making it easier and more affordable for homeowners to switch to solar energy.

title: Heat Pumps for Multifamily Homes - ACHR NEWS
summary: The article discusses the increasing adoption of heat pumps in multifamily homes, driven by incentives and the need for decarbonization. Packaged Window Heat Pumps (PWHPs) are a new technology that is being tested for use in NYC multifamily buildings to help meet the city's Clean Heat for All Challenge. Education and training are important for contractors to keep up with the evolving HVAC technology and ensure proper installation.

title: NGK Decides construction of a new R&D building ~ Accelerating the development and promoting early ... - Mynewsdesk
summary: NGK Insulators, Ltd. (NGK) is building a new R&D building at its head office site to encourage the development of products related to a digital society (DS). NGK aims to achieve ¥50 billion of the NV1000 target from sales of new DS-related products, such as new wafers for applications including wireless communications, optical networks, and in-vehicle sensors for automatic driving. The new R&D building will be equipped with a photovoltaic power generation system on the roof for energy-saving, and in the future, perovskite solar cells will be installed on the walls, and renewable energy generated by the entire building will be used to reduce CO2 emissions.

title: European Union launches second edition of Circular Economy Competition - GhanaWeb
summary: The European Union's Circular Economy Competition is open to applications from Ghanaian small businesses and start-ups with green and circular economy ideas. The competition promotes resource efficiency, reduces waste generation, and supports economic growth through sustainable practices. Selected contestants will receive training and have the chance to win seed funding for their circular economy businesses.

title: CES 2023: Jackery LightTent-AIR is a revolution for campers - Basic Tutorials
summary: Jackery, a company specializing in sustainable energy solutions, unveiled the Jackery LightTent-AIR, a futuristic tent that generates electricity using integrated solar cells. This tent has the potential to revolutionize camping by providing a reliable power source in remote areas. The LightTent-AIR's solar cells can generate 1,200 watts of power, which can be stored in the tent's storage modules or in a compatible power station.
